page.title: 03CALEDONIAN CANAL,FT.AUGUSTUS
page.content: The building of the canal cost about one million pounds.The first ship sailed from{Fort William}to{Inverness} in 1822. Until the late seventies,fishing boats from the North East and East coast ports,travelling to the fishing grounds off the west coast of { {Scotland},were the chief users of the waterway,but now it is used mainly by holiday makers in pleasure cruisers.Last year 4076 of these craft passed through the locks,whereas there were only 202 fishing boats and 26 other craft. As you enter the canal at{Fort {Augustus}from the east end of{Loch {Ness},{Fort Augustus Abbey}can be seen on your port side.On your starboard side,the skeleton of the old paddle steamer {Gairlochy},which burned out there in 1919.
